title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 June 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:27 <Trefex> hi tmortagne and all  
10:28 <Trefex> i didn't do anything on my xwiki yet, and the admin icons have dissapeared  
10:28 <Trefex> they are all getting 404's now

12:24 <vmassol> btw guys Guillaume Laforge (now part of Restlet) told me that restlet supports adding dynamically new endpoints  
12:24 <vmassol> (he says calling attach() on the Router object should work)  
12:24 <tmortagne> cool  
12:24 <tmortagne> first we need to upgrade :)  
12:24 <vmassol> (someone should explore this at some point)  
12:24 <vmassol> yep  
12:26 <vmassol> (and I see we create a Router in XWikiRestletJaxRsApplication  
12:26 <vmassol>  )  
12:26 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <vmassol> (we even call attach() in 2 places already)

16:45 <lucaa> has quit  
16:46 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:57 <vmassol> guys, I don't remember which fwk we want to use: jdom2 or dom4j…  I think it's jdom2, do you agree?  
16:58 <tmortagne> I don't think we really discussed that  
17:00 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:00 <vmassol> haha: http://www.dom4j.org/dom4j-1.6.1/ ;)  
17:01 <vmassol> the web site for dom4j is not very appealing: http://dom4j.sourceforge.net/  
17:02 <vmassol> Goals for version 2.0: " • compatible with Java 5"  
17:02 <vmassol> oh that's so nice! (sarcastic tone)  
17:03 <vmassol> I tihk we can safely says that dom4j is not maintained anymore: https://sourceforge.net/projects/dom4j/files/  
17:07 <vmassol> mail sent  
17:07 <cjd> hey, they have java5 compatibility and we don't :(  
17:08 <cjd> oh, it's only a goal, ok then  
17:09 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:19 <woshilapin> Hi devs, pure coincidence of the day, I found this https://github.com/xwikisas/xcs/blob/master/xcs-web/pom.xml#L256  
17:19 <vmassol> yep  
17:19 <woshilapin> And I've work recently on transformation with saxon  
17:19 <vmassol> I wrote this  
17:19 <woshilapin> Which seems to support more recent XSL than Xalan  
17:20 <woshilapin> And probably support the same standard of interface  
17:20 <woshilapin> Just to mention  
17:21 <vmassol> yes could be a good replacement but the problem is that most fwk we use use xalan transitively  
17:21 <vmassol> (for example jdom2 2.0.6 uses xalan 2.7.2)  
17:22 <woshilapin> Argh  
17:23 <woshilapin> But if the dependency you use has itself a dependency which is Xalan, don't know exactly how you plan to remove Xalan  
17:23 <woshilapin> :-)  
17:23 <vmassol> no idea :)  
17:23 <vmassol> the second option listed sounds better though  
17:23 <vmassol> "or find a good maven packaging of it "  
17:24 <tmortagne> yes, best would be a better xalan package  
17:25 <tmortagne> the issue is that we have this dependency at commons level so we can't just do this package ourself (like I do for jython for this kind of reasons)  
17:25 <woshilapin> In any case, so far that I've investigated, if everything in Jdom2 uses the standard javax.xml.transform interface, then switching to Saxon in Jdom2 should not be a big problem  
17:25 <woshilapin> (but I don't know if you can force such thing to a dependency... niark  
17:26 <vmassol> yes you're right  
17:27 <vmassol> and jdom's pom does mention that xalan is optional  
17:27 <vmassol> i don't know why they depend on it btw  
17:27 <vmassol> they should depend on the interfaces only  
17:27 <woshilapin> Because they need to depend on one implementation at one point  
17:27 <woshilapin> ?  
17:27 <vmassol> why?  
17:28 <vmassol> you're supposed to be able to pick the impl you wish  
17:28 <woshilapin> it was a question...  
17:28 <vmassol> (I know it was a question)  
17:28 <vmassol> :)  
17:28 <woshilapin> OK, but then it means that if you compile JDom2 without configuration, you can't use it, right?  
17:28 <woshilapin> You need to know that you need to add an implementation  
17:28 <vmassol> you need an impl to use it  
17:29 <vmassol> so  
17:29 <vmassol> first you add a compile dep on the interface  
17:29 <vmassol> and if you wish you can add a \*runtime\* dep on xalan as optional  
17:29 <vmassol> (if you really need it but I don't think it's needed for a lib)  
17:29 <woshilapin> You're the master of Maven (or to say it differently, this is where I'm a bit lost)  
17:29 <woshilapin> :-P  
17:29 <vmassol> (if it were an app it would be a different story)  
17:31 <vmassol> and JAXP is in the JDK normally  
17:31 <vmassol> so you don't even need an dep on the interfaces  
17:31 <vmassol> (xalan also is in the jdk btw but ;))  
17:34 <tmortagne> yes you have an implementation by default so you don't NEED xalan  
17:39 <mflorea> has quit  
17:41 <ol-ow2> has quit  
17:43 <Trefex> anybody on?  
17:43 <vmassol> nope :)  
17:43 <Trefex> good  
17:43 <vmassol> (kidding)  
17:43 <Trefex> i didn't do anything, seriously,  
17:43 <Trefex> but the admin icons are all 404 again  
17:44 <vmassol> have you considered that it could be neutrinos affecting your computer? :)  
17:44 \* vmassol is in a joking mood  
17:44 <Trefex> seriously, i seem to have the badest luck with xWiki in the universe  
17:44 <vmassol> universe, neutrinos, see!  
17:45 <vmassol> ok going to hide now...  
17:45 <Trefex> no don't go hide  
17:45 <Trefex> help :D  
17:46 <Trefex> http://i.imgur.com/xvluV90.png  
17:46 <Trefex> you see?  
17:46 <vmassol> (first I need to finish some code and I haven't followed your problem, maybe someone has who's here)  
17:46 <vmassol> yep I see  
17:46 <vmassol> get téhe URL  
17:46 <vmassol> get the URL for the broken links  
17:47 <Trefex> https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/bin/download/XWiki/AdminSheet/content.png Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)  
17:47 <Trefex> and more  
17:49 <Trefex> vmassol: any roads I could pursue in the meantime?  
17:50 <vmassol> Trefex: check XWiki.AdminSheet  
17:50 <vmassol> and see if it has an attachment named "content.png"  
17:50 <vmassol> make sure you don't have front end in front of xwiki  
17:50 <vmassol> \*have any  
17:50 <Trefex> ah crap, i changed to DB as filestore
